intro: Buteraea parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved buteraea, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually less than 2 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the spring. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. Buteraea parvifolia is typically found in moist, shaded areas of temperate forests.
